info.about: On the website, you will be able to get acquainted and learn something new about the Dutch royal family and its members in particular.
info.aims: Our portal aims to enlighten society about the existence of other royal families besides the British one.
info.toWhom: In addition to historians and 'knowledgeable' individuals, the site is suitable for ordinary curious users.

king-willem-alexander.name: King Willem-Alexander
king-willem-alexander.description: Willem-Alexander is King of the Netherlands, having acceded to the throne following his mother's abdication in 2013.

timelineItems.timelineText: On April 27, 1967, Willem-Alexander Claus George Ferdinand is born in Utrecht, Netherlands, as the eldest son of Princess Beatrix and Prince Claus.
On April 30, 1980, Princess Beatrix ascends the throne, and Willem-Alexander becomes the Prince of Orange, the heir apparent.
Prince Willem-Alexander studies history at Leiden University.
In 2002, Willem-Alexander marries Máxima Zorreguieta Cerruti, an Argentine investment banker, on February 2.
On December 7, 2003, their first child, Princess Catharina-Amalia, is born.
On April 30, 2013, Willem-Alexander becomes the first Dutch king in over a century after the abdication of his mother, Queen Beatrix.
The investiture ceremony takes place in Amsterdam on April 30, 2013, marking the official start of his reign.
On April 10, 2007, King Willem-Alexander and Queen Máxima welcome their third daughter, Princess Ariane.
In October 2018, King Willem-Alexander and Queen Máxima make a state visit to the United Kingdom.
In 2020, like many other leaders, King Willem-Alexander addresses the challenges posed by the global COVID-19 pandemic.
In 2022, King Willem-Alexander may participate in events celebrating the Platinum Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II.

queen-maxima.name: Queen Máxima
queen-maxima.description: Máxima (born Máxima Zorreguieta) is Queen of the Netherlands as the wife of King Willem-Alexander.

timelineItems.timelineText: On May 17, 1971, Máxima Zorreguieta Cerruti is born in Buenos Aires, Argentina.
Máxima completes her degree in Economics at Northlands School and later works in finance, including at Deutsche Bank.
On February 2, 2002, Máxima marries Willem-Alexander, the Prince of Orange, becoming Princess Máxima of the Netherlands.
On December 7, 2003, Máxima and Willem-Alexander welcome their first child, Princess Catharina-Amalia.
On June 26, 2005, their second daughter, Princess Alexia, is born.
On April 10, 2007, Máxima gives birth to their third daughter, Princess Ariane.
On April 30, 2013, Willem-Alexander ascends the throne, and Máxima becomes Queen consort of the Netherlands.
In October 2018, Queen Máxima accompanies King Willem-Alexander on a state visit to the United Kingdom.
In 2020, Queen Máxima, alongside the royal family, addresses the challenges posed by the global COVID-19 pandemic.
In 2022, Queen Máxima may participate in events celebrating the Platinum Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II.

princess-beatrix.name: Princess Beatrix
princess-beatrix.description: Beatrix is a member of the Dutch royal house who reigned as Queen of the Netherlands from 1980 until her abdication in 2013.

timelineItems.timelineText: On January 31, 1938, Beatrix Wilhelmina Armgard is born in Soestdijk Palace, Netherlands.
On March 10, 1966, Beatrix marries Claus von Amsberg, a German diplomat.
On April 27, 1967, Beatrix becomes a mother with the birth of her first son, Willem-Alexander.
On April 30, 1980, Beatrix becomes Queen of the Netherlands after the abdication of her mother, Queen Juliana.
On September 25, 1968, Beatrix welcomes her second son, Prince Friso.
On April 30, 2013, Beatrix abdicates in favor of her eldest son, Willem-Alexander, who becomes the King of the Netherlands.
Following her abdication, Beatrix retires from public duties and takes on a more private life.

the-princess-of-orange.name: Princess of Orange
the-princess-of-orange.description: Catharina-Amalia, Princess of Orange is the heir apparent to the throne of the Kingdom of the Netherlands, which consists of the constituent countries of Aruba, Curaçao, the Netherlands, and Sint Maarten.

timelineItems.timelineText: On December 7, 2003, Catharina-Amalia Beatrix Carmen Victoria is born in The Hague, Netherlands.
On April 30, 2013, Catharina-Amalia's father, Willem-Alexander, ascends the throne as the King of the Netherlands.
Catharina-Amalia attends the investiture ceremony of her father in Amsterdam on April 30, 2013.
As a teenager, Catharina-Amalia continues her education and takes on some royal duties and public appearances.
In 2020, Catharina-Amalia, like many others, addresses challenges posed by the global COVID-19 pandemic.
As of 2022, Catharina-Amalia is expected to continue her education and gradually take on more responsibilities within the royal family.

princess-alexia.name: Princess Alexia
princess-alexia.description: Princess Alexia of the Netherlands, Princess of Orange-Nassau is the second daughter of Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands and Queen Máxima of the Netherlands. Princess Alexia is a member of the Dutch royal house and second in the line of succession to the Dutch throne.

timelineItems.timelineText: On June 26, 2005, Alexia Juliana Marcela Laurentien is born in The Hague, Netherlands.
On April 30, 2013, Alexia's father, Willem-Alexander, ascends the throne as the King of the Netherlands.
Alexia attends the investiture ceremony of her father in Amsterdam on April 30, 2013.
As a teenager, Alexia continues her education and engages in various royal duties and public events.
In 2020, Alexia, like many others, addresses challenges posed by the global COVID-19 pandemic.
As of 2022, Alexia is expected to continue her education and gradually take on more responsibilities within the royal family.

princess-ariane.name: Princess Ariane
princess-ariane.description: Princess Ariane of the Netherlands, Princess of Orange-Nassau is the third and youngest daughter of King Willem-Alexander and Queen Máxima. Princess Ariane is a member of the Dutch Royal House and currently third in the line of succession to the Dutch throne.

timelineItems.timelineText: On April 10, 2007, Ariane Wilhelmina Máxima Ines is born in The Hague, Netherlands.
On April 30, 2013, Ariane's father, Willem-Alexander, ascends the throne as the King of the Netherlands.
Ariane attends the investiture ceremony of her father in Amsterdam on April 30, 2013.
Growing up, Ariane enjoys her childhood and family life, participating in various royal events.
In 2020, Ariane, like many others, addresses challenges posed by the global COVID-19 pandemic.
As of 2022, Ariane continues her education and is expected to gradually take on more responsibilities within the royal family.

prince-constantijn.name: Prince Constantijn
prince-constantijn.description: Prince Constantijn of the Netherlands is the third and youngest son of the former Dutch queen, Beatrix, and her husband, Claus von Amsberg, and is the younger brother of the reigning Dutch king, Willem-Alexander. He is a member of the Dutch Royal House and currently fourth in the line of succession to the Dutch throne behind his nieces.

timelineItems.timelineText: On October 11, 1969, Constantijn Christof Frederik Aschwin is born in Utrecht, Netherlands.
Prince Constantijn is christened on December 19, 1969.
Constantijn studies law at Leiden University and later works in various roles, including at the European Commission.
On May 19, 2001, Constantijn marries Laurentien Brinkhorst.
On June 8, 2002, Prince Constantijn and Princess Laurentien welcome their first child, Eloise Sophie Beatrix Laurence.
On March 21, 2004, their second son, Claus-Casimir Bernhard Marius Max, is born.
On June 3, 2006, Prince Constantijn and Princess Laurentien welcome their second daughter, Leonore Marie Irene Enrica.
On April 30, 2013, Constantijn's older brother, Willem-Alexander, ascends the throne as the King of the Netherlands.
In 2022, Prince Constantijn may participate in events celebrating the Platinum Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II.

princess-laurentien.name: Princess Laurentien
princess-laurentien.description: Princess Laurentien of the Netherlands (born Petra Laurentien Brinkhorst) is the wife of Prince Constantijn and sister-in-law of King Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands.

timelineItems.timelineText: On May 25, 1966, Petra Laurentien Brinkhorst is born in Leiden, Netherlands.
Princess Laurentien is christened on June 19, 1966.
Laurentien studies economics and later works in various roles, including at the European Patent Office.
On May 19, 2001, Laurentien Brinkhorst marries Prince Constantijn of the Netherlands.
On June 8, 2002, Princess Laurentien and Prince Constantijn welcome their first child, Eloise Sophie Beatrix Laurence.
On March 21, 2004, their second son, Claus-Casimir Bernhard Marius Max, is born.
On June 3, 2006, Princess Laurentien and Prince Constantijn welcome their second daughter, Leonore Marie Irene Enrica.
Laurentien is known for her involvement in literacy and cultural activities, promoting reading and education.
In 2022, Princess Laurentien may participate in events celebrating the Platinum Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II.

princess-margriet.name: Princess Margriet
princess-margriet.description: Princess Margriet of the Netherlands (Margriet Francisca) s the third daughter of Queen Juliana and Prince Bernhard. As an aunt of the reigning monarch, King Willem-Alexander, she is a member of the Dutch Royal House and currently eighth and last in the line of succession to the throne.

timelineItems.timelineText: On January 19, 1943, Princess Margriet Francisca is born in Ottawa, Canada.
Princess Margriet's birth takes place at the Ottawa Civic Hospital, as her mother, Princess Juliana, sought refuge in Canada during World War II.
After the war, Princess Margriet returns to the Netherlands with her family.
On January 10, 1967, Princess Margriet marries Pieter van Vollenhoven.
On April 17, 1968, Princess Margriet and Pieter van Vollenhoven welcome their first son, Maurits.
On December 25, 1969, their second son, Bernhard, is born.
On March 22, 1972, Princess Margriet and Pieter van Vollenhoven's third son, Pieter-Christiaan, is born.
On April 10, 1975, their fourth son, Floris, is born.
Princess Margriet is involved in various charitable activities and serves as a patron of several organizations.
In 2022, Princess Margriet may participate in events celebrating the Platinum Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II.
